artist: Artist: Itō Shinsui; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: portrait; woman in profile from PL, with her sleeve held to her mouth; woman wears red and yellow hair ornament and black kimono with white, green, yellow and brown floral design
inscription: 大正十二年十二月 {Taishō jūninen jūnigatsu} (December 1923)
markings: red artist\'s seal: 伊東 {Itō} | publisher seal: ワタナベ {Watanabe} | on back, red seal 百五拾枚限り絶版　第一二七番 {hyakugojū mai kagiri zeppan, dai hyakunijūnana ban} (limited edition of 150, number 127)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Twelve Forms of New Beauties (Shin bijin jūni sugata 新美人十二姿)
text: Twelfth and last print of the series Twelve Forms of New Beauties (Shin bijin jūni sugata) and Shinsui's first print produced after the Great Kantō earthquake of September 1, 1923.
title: Melancholy in Spring
